articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel's military said on Tuesday it struck dozens of Hezbollah targets in southern Lebanon overnight, a day after it launched a wave of airstrikes against the Iran-backed group's sites in Lebanon's deadliest day in decades.
articles.title: Israel and Hezbollah exchange fire after Lebanon suffers huge casualties

articles.author: John Irish, Parisa Hafezi, Jonathan Landay
articles.description: Iran has brokered ongoing secret talks between Russia and Yemen's Houthi rebels to transfer anti-ship missiles to the militant group, three Western and regional sources said, a development that highlights Tehran's deepening ties to Moscow.
articles.title: Exclusive: Iran brokering talks to send advanced Russian missiles to Yemen's Houthis, sources say

articles.author: Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: Iran is ready to end its nuclear standoff with the West, Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian told the United Nations General Assembly on Tuesday, while calling for an end to Russia's war in Ukraine through dialogue.
articles.title: Iran's Pezeshkian says Tehran ready to work with world powers to resolve nuclear standoff

articles.author: Manuel Ausloos
articles.description: With more Israeli communities moving into Hezbollah's crosshairs as Israel hits deeper in Lebanon, some in northern Israel hoped their country could finally end the threat of the Lebanese armed group, while others viewed the rising violence with resignation.
articles.title: In Israel's north, stress and resignation as missiles fly

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The man accused of staking out Donald Trump’s Florida golf course with a rifle was indicted on Tuesday on a charge of attempted assassination of a political candidate as prosecutors alleged he intended to kill the former U.S. president, CNN reported.
articles.title: US charges suspected Trump gunman with attempted assassination, CNN reports

articles.author: Patricia Zengerle
articles.description: The Republican-led U.S. House of Representatives Foreign Affairs Committee recommended on Tuesday that Secretary of State Antony Blinken be held in contempt of Congress for failing to comply with a subpoena seeking information about the chaotic 2021 U.S. withdrawal from Afghanistan.
articles.title: US House committee recommends contempt charge for Blinken

articles.author: Steve Holland
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden will look to burnish his foreign policy legacy in a U.N. speech on Tuesday, still facing the challenges posed by Ukraine's effort to repel Russian invaders and in a Middle East mired in war.
articles.title: Biden to address UN General Assembly for the last time as president

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia hit a high-rise apartment block in Ukraine's northeastern city of Kharkiv during an attack with guided bombs on Tuesday, killing at least three people and injuring 15 more, with others feared trapped under rubble, local authorities said.
articles.title: Russia strikes apartment block in Ukraine's Kharkiv, three killed, 15 injured

articles.author: Simon Lewis
articles.description: Killings of local humanitarian workers in conflicts around the world must provoke the same outrage as international aid workers harmed in conflict, the head of the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Red Cross appeals for more attention on deaths of local aid workers

articles.author: Alexander Tanas
articles.description: A record 11 candidates have been approved for Moldova's presidential poll next month, electoral officials said on Tuesday, including incumbent Maia Sandu, who portrays the contest as a test of her drive to join the European Union.
articles.title: Eleven candidates, including incumbent, to compete in Moldova presidential vote
